item.title: ZSFG expert page transformation
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
There’s another update to the ongoing project to emphasize human-centered service provided by the library. The ZSFG Library page is no longer just a location page — it now highlights the full breadth of services users can expect. ZSFG Library has always been more challenging to represent and promote, because it serves ...

Read moreZSFG expert page transformation

item.title: Video orientation
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
The library home page now has an embedded video orientation to the library. This overview of our spaces, services, and collections is delivered in a friendly and engaging way by Ariel. It was originally part of a longer UCSF orientation video, but the library section has been extracted, and Sean ...

Read moreVideo orientation

item.title: Welcome Danielle Westmark, our IPI Fellow!
item.dc:creator: Ariel Deardorff
item.description:
Danielle is a student in the Inter-professional Informationist (IPI) Program at Simmons University and will be working with Ariel and the Data Science team from Jan-May 2021 as part of her capstone project. Danielle is looking to build on her knowledge of research data management, data science, and reproducibility and ...

Read moreWelcome Danielle Westmark, our IPI Fellow!

item.title: Welcome to the Library Albert Lee!
item.dc:creator: Karla Lindquist
item.description:
On January 4 2021, Albert Lee joined the Library’s Data Science Initiative team as a Data Science Instructional Designer and Analyst. Please join the DSI team in welcoming Albert to UCSF and to the Library! Albert will be working with the DSI team two days per week. He will be ...

item.title: Congratulations Andy, recipient of the STAR Spot Award!
item.dc:creator: Chris Shaffer
item.description:
During the period of four months (from July through the end of October 2020) Andy Panado provided critical service for the library beyond his regular duties, enabling successful completion of the UCSF Special Collections Inventory and Cataloging Project of the Rare Book collection. In January 2020 the library contracted with ...

item.title: Building Data Skills in California Libraries
item.dc:creator: Ariel Deardorff
item.description:
Ariel shares about a project she worked on this year with the nonprofit organization The Carpentries From Jan to Sept of this year 20% of my time was dedicated to a grant-funded project with The Carpentries, a global non-profit dedicated to teaching data and software skills to researchers and librarians. ...

Read moreBuilding Data Skills in California Libraries

item.title: Highlighting services during closure
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
By default, the library already offers many services where the location of the user is not an obstacle. For example, we provide online access to many articles and ebooks. We also provide support and consultations via email, phone, or Zoom. In light of the lengthy buildings closure during the COVID-19 ...

Read moreHighlighting services during closure

item.title: Equity in Publishing & Open Science Initiative
item.dc:creator: Anneliese Taylor
item.description:
Jill, Ariel, and I have embarked on a new project and we’d love to get your feedback. We will be building a network of faculty journal editors and connecting this network with often-underrepresented groups including early career faculty and researchers and those from groups underrepresented in medicine (UIM). The network ...

Read moreEquity in Publishing & Open Science Initiative

item.dc:creator: Joanna Kang
item.description:
LinkedIn Learning: Now Available for UCSF LinkedIn Learning (previously Lynda.com) is now available to UCSF through a campus license. LinkedIn Learning has thousands of video courses covering technical, business, software, and creative topics. Courses include: Zoom Engagement for Meetings, Working From Home Strategies, Using Python for Automation, EndNote Essentials, and ...

item.title: User Research Results Part 2: Library News
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
News posts and newsletter content enable the library to share current happenings and to highlight and promote services. Our goal is to make these types of information discoverable in multiple places and whenever possible, put them into the path of the people who will find them most useful. Some users ...
